channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Online Game Level Generation from Music
item.description: Game consists of multiple types of content, while the harmony of different content types play an essential role in game design.

item.title: HelixFold: An Efficient Implementation of AlphaFold2 using PaddlePaddle
item.description: Due to the complex model architecture and large memory consumption, it requires lots of computational resources and time to implement the training and inference of AlphaFold2 from scratch.

item.title: DGPO: Discovering Multiple Strategies with Diversity-Guided Policy Optimization
item.description: Recent algorithms designed for reinforcement learning tasks focus on finding a single optimal solution.

item.title: Multi-Behavior Hypergraph-Enhanced Transformer for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Further ablation studies validate the effectiveness of our model design and benefits of the new MBHT framework.

item.title: UniNet: Unified Architecture Search with Convolution, Transformer, and MLP
item.description: Finally, we integrate configurable operators and DSMs into a unified search space and search with a Reinforcement Learning-based search algorithm to fully explore the optimal combination of the operators.

item.title: Frequency Domain Model Augmentation for Adversarial Attack
item.description: Specifically, we apply a spectrum transformation to the input and thus perform the model augmentation in the frequency domain.

item.title: Modality-Aware Contrastive Instance Learning with Self-Distillation for Weakly-Supervised Audio-Visual Violence Detection
item.description: In this paper, we analyze the modality asynchrony and undifferentiated instances phenomena of the multiple instance learning (MIL) procedure, and further investigate its negative impact on weakly-supervised audio-visual learning.

item.title: CCPL: Contrastive Coherence Preserving Loss for Versatile Style Transfer
item.description: CCPL can preserve the coherence of the content source during style transfer without degrading stylization.

item.title: Gradual Domain Adaptation without Indexed Intermediate Domains
item.description: This coarse domain sequence then undergoes a fine indexing step via a novel cycle-consistency loss, which encourages the next intermediate domain to preserve sufficient discriminative knowledge of the current intermediate domain.

item.title: No Language Left Behind: Scaling Human-Centered Machine Translation
item.description: Driven by the goal of eradicating language barriers on a global scale, machine translation has solidified itself as a key focus of artificial intelligence research today.

item.title: The Cosmic Graph: Optimal Information Extraction from Large-Scale Structure using Catalogues
item.description: We a) demonstrate the high sensitivity of modular graph structure to the underlying cosmology in the noise-free limit, b) show that networks automatically combine mass and clustering information through comparisons to traditional statistics, c) demonstrate that graph neural networks can still extract information when catalogues are subject to noisy survey cuts, and d) illustrate how nonlinear IMNN summaries can be used as asymptotically optimal compressed statistics for Bayesian implicit likelihood inference.

item.title: Audio-Visual Segmentation
item.description: To deal with the AVS problem, we propose a novel method that uses a temporal pixel-wise audio-visual interaction module to inject audio semantics as guidance for the visual segmentation process.

item.title: How Robust is your Fair Model? Exploring the Robustness of Diverse Fairness Strategies
item.description: Recent studies have shown that robustness (the ability for a model to perform well on unseen data) plays a significant role in the type of strategy that should be used when approaching a new problem and, hence, measuring the robustness of these strategies has become a fundamental problem.

item.title: Assessing Ranking and Effectiveness of Evolutionary Algorithm Hyperparameters Using Global Sensitivity Analysis Methodologies
item.description: We present a comprehensive global sensitivity analysis of two single-objective and two multi-objective state-of-the-art global optimization evolutionary algorithms as an algorithm configuration problem.

item.title: Intra-Modal Constraint Loss For Image-Text Retrieval
item.description: Cross-modal retrieval has drawn much attention in both computer vision and natural language processing domains.

item.title: Towards Scale-Aware, Robust, and Generalizable Unsupervised Monocular Depth Estimation by Integrating IMU Motion Dynamics
item.description: Unsupervised monocular depth and ego-motion estimation has drawn extensive research attention in recent years.

item.title: Embedding Recycling for Language Models
item.description: Training and inference with large neural models is expensive.

item.title: Slot Filling for Extracting Reskilling and Upskilling Options from the Web
item.description: Disturbances in the job market such as advances in science and technology, crisis and increased competition have triggered a surge in reskilling and upskilling programs.

item.title: CAMS: An Annotated Corpus for Causal Analysis of Mental Health Issues in Social Media Posts
item.description: We introduce a new dataset for Causal Analysis of Mental health issues in Social media posts (CAMS).

item.title: Multimodal Multi-objective Optimization: Comparative Study of the State-of-the-Art
item.description: Multimodal multi-objective problems (MMOPs) commonly arise in real-world problems where distant solutions in decision space correspond to very similar objective values.

item.title: Instance Shadow Detection with A Single-Stage Detector
item.description: This paper formulates a new problem, instance shadow detection, which aims to detect shadow instance and the associated object instance that cast each shadow in the input image.

item.title: A Federated Cox Model with Non-Proportional Hazards
item.description: Recent research has shown the potential for neural networks to improve upon classical survival models such as the Cox model, which is widely used in clinical practice.

item.title: A Penalty Approach for Normalizing Feature Distributions to Build Confounder-Free Models
item.description: In this paper, we extend the MDN method by applying a Penalty approach (referred to as PDMN).

item.title: Long-term Reproducibility for Neural Architecture Search
item.description: It is a sad reflection of modern academia that code is often ignored after publication -- there is no academic 'kudos' for bug fixes / maintenance.

item.title: A Baselined Gated Attention Recurrent Network for Request Prediction in Ridesharing
item.description: Ridesharing has received global popularity due to its convenience and cost efficiency for both drivers and passengers and its strong potential to contribute to the implementation of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

item.title: SDFEst: Categorical Pose and Shape Estimation of Objects from RGB-D using Signed Distance Fields
item.description: Rich geometric understanding of the world is an important component of many robotic applications such as planning and manipulation.

item.title: Hierarchical Latent Structure for Multi-Modal Vehicle Trajectory Forecasting
item.description: We observe that a similar problem, in which the generated trajectory is located between adjacent lanes, often arises in VAE-based trajectory forecasting models.

item.title: Multi-Study Boosting: Theoretical Considerations for Merging vs. Ensembling
item.description: In the regression setting, we provide theoretical guidelines based on an analytical transition point to determine whether it is more beneficial to merge or to ensemble for boosting with linear learners.

item.title: PSP-HDRI$+$: A Synthetic Dataset Generator for Pre-Training of Human-Centric Computer Vision Models
item.description: We introduce a new synthetic data generator PSP-HDRI$+$ that proves to be a superior pre-training alternative to ImageNet and other large-scale synthetic data counterparts.

item.title: Dual Vision Transformer
item.description: Dual-ViT is henceforth able to reduce the computational complexity without compromising much accuracy.

item.title: Wave-ViT: Unifying Wavelet and Transformers for Visual Representation Learning
item.description: Motivated by the wavelet theory, we construct a new Wavelet Vision Transformer (\textbf{Wave-ViT}) that formulates the invertible down-sampling with wavelet transforms and self-attention learning in a unified way.

item.title: Consistency is the key to further mitigating catastrophic forgetting in continual learning
item.description: Therefore, we examine the role of consistency regularization in ER framework under various continual learning scenarios.

item.title: Start Small, Think Big: On Hyperparameter Optimization for Large-Scale Knowledge Graph Embeddings
item.description: Knowledge graph embedding (KGE) models are an effective and popular approach to represent and reason with multi-relational data.

item.title: DCCF: Deep Comprehensible Color Filter Learning Framework for High-Resolution Image Harmonization
item.description: Image color harmonization algorithm aims to automatically match the color distribution of foreground and background images captured in different conditions.

item.title: TASKOGRAPHY: Evaluating robot task planning over large 3D scene graphs
item.description: 3D scene graphs (3DSGs) are an emerging description; unifying symbolic, topological, and metric scene representations.

item.title: Cross-modal Prototype Driven Network for Radiology Report Generation
item.description: Radiology report generation (RRG) aims to describe automatically a radiology image with human-like language and could potentially support the work of radiologists, reducing the burden of manual reporting.

item.title: COO: Comic Onomatopoeia Dataset for Recognizing Arbitrary or Truncated Texts
item.description: To encourage research on this topic, we provide a novel comic onomatopoeia dataset (COO), which consists of onomatopoeia texts in Japanese comics.

item.title: Exploring Contextual Relationships for Cervical Abnormal Cell Detection
item.description: Specifically, both contextual relationships between cells and cell-to-global images are exploited to enhance features of each region of interest (RoI) proposals.

item.title: A clinically motivated self-supervised approach for content-based image retrieval of CT liver images
item.description: We address these limitations by (1) proposing a self-supervised learning framework that incorporates domain-knowledge into the training procedure and (2) providing the first representation learning explainability analysis in the context of CBIR of CT liver images.

item.title: Fast-Vid2Vid: Spatial-Temporal Compression for Video-to-Video Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we present a spatial-temporal compression framework, \textbf{Fast-Vid2Vid}, which focuses on data aspects of generative models.

item.title: Functional Generalized Empirical Likelihood Estimation for Conditional Moment Restrictions
item.description: Important problems in causal inference, economics, and, more generally, robust machine learning can be expressed as conditional moment restrictions, but estimation becomes challenging as it requires solving a continuum of unconditional moment restrictions.

item.title: Personalizing Federated Medical Image Segmentation via Local Calibration
item.description: Personalized FL tackles this issue by only utilizing partial model parameters shared from global server, while keeping the rest to adapt to its own data distribution in the local training of each site.

item.title: Planning Sequential Tasks on Contact Graph
item.description: We devise a 3D scene graph representation, contact graph+ (cg+), for efficient sequential task planning.

item.title: Nobel students beget Nobel professors
item.description: It is unclear whether the hierarchy in the economics profession is the result of the agglomeration of excellence or of nepotism.

item.title: Radiomics-Guided Global-Local Transformer for Weakly Supervised Pathology Localization in Chest X-Rays
item.description: RGT consists of an image Transformer branch, a radiomics Transformer branch, and fusion layers that aggregate image and radiomic information.

item.title: 2DPASS: 2D Priors Assisted Semantic Segmentation on LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: As camera and LiDAR sensors capture complementary information used in autonomous driving, great efforts have been made to develop semantic segmentation algorithms through multi-modality data fusion.

item.title: Multilingual Persuasion Detection: Video Games as an Invaluable Data Source for NLP
item.description: Role-playing games (RPGs) have a considerable amount of text in video game dialogues.

item.title: Automating Detection of Papilledema in Pediatric Fundus Images with Explainable Machine Learning
item.description: Papilledema is an ophthalmic neurologic disorder in which increased intracranial pressure leads to swelling of the optic nerves.

item.title: Sparse Pairwise Re-ranking with Pre-trained Transformers
item.description: Pairwise re-ranking models predict which of two documents is more relevant to a query and then aggregate a final ranking from such preferences.

item.title: Towards Proper Contrastive Self-supervised Learning Strategies For Music Audio Representation
item.description: The common research goal of self-supervised learning is to extract a general representation which an arbitrary downstream task would benefit from.
